course.title: Advanced TypeScript Patterns
course.description: Deep dive into TypeScript advanced features. Learn generics, utility types, decorators, and design patterns for large-scale applications.

lessons.title: Generic Functions
lessons.content: Create generic functions with type parameters.

lessons.title: Generic Classes
lessons.content: Build generic classes for reusable code.

lessons.title: Partial and Required
lessons.content: Use Partial and Required utility types.

lessons.title: Pick and Omit
lessons.content: Select or exclude properties with Pick and Omit.

lessons.title: Singleton Pattern
lessons.content: Implement the Singleton pattern in TypeScript.

lessons.title: Factory Pattern
lessons.content: Create objects with the Factory pattern.

labs.title: Generic Functions
labs.instructions:
Create a generic identity function
Test with number and string types
Log the results

labs.title: Generic Arrays
labs.instructions:
Create a function that returns the first element of any array
Use generics for type safety
Test with different array types

test.title: TypeScript Advanced Patterns Test
test.description: Test your knowledge of TypeScript generics and utility types.

questions.question: What is a generic type in TypeScript?
options: A type that can work with multiple types
A type that only works with objects
A type for generic functions only
A type that cannot be changed

questions.question: Which utility type makes all properties optional?
What does the Pick utility type do?
options: Creates a type with selected properties

questions.question: How do you constrain a generic type?
What is the Omit utility type used for?

project.title: Type-Safe API Client
project.description: Build a fully type-safe API client library using advanced TypeScript patterns.
requirements: Add error handling with discriminated unions
Create utility types for API responses
